item.title: Numb
item.description:
To the recent air-crash. To the Iran-Israel escalation. To the Israel-Palestine conflict. To the massive layoffs happening all over the federal space. To the incessant pollution on the roads. To the mindless spending all over. To the massive disparity across realms.

Walking over to Masks for a couple drinks and that falafel burger. Playing Breath of the WIld like nobody’s business. Debating pros and cons of a neuro program in UCL. Ordering multiple T1000Es to tinker with. Planning future travel across waters. Living in this messed up world, raising a kid just like those gazillion out there who’re going to wonder what the heck their parents and ancestors did and did’nt do.

All of this does not compute. Numb at so many levels… ðŸ”—

item.title: Little joys
item.description:
The short rainy season is almost about to end here. There’s still no dearth of monsoon drama though. A warm and humid afternoon leads in to a breezy evening. In just a few moments, it feels like you’ve been transported to a coastal town. The surrounding hills lock in the clouds and the barometric pressure drops. Denser dark clouds churn their way up and magnificently roll up the hills only to be forced down. Small static crackles lead in to thunderous lightnings, all in a matter of few minutes.

Cocooned in a hammock, music by the side with this little one observing all the moves and doling out a cascade of chuckles from things related and not. Little joys.

item.title: letting go
item.description:
Bailing out to the new media - Will we though? In some form or fashion those that are leaving are probably just finding a different medium where they’re able to connect better? I actually think there are more people blogging now than before. Just in different dispersed mediums.

And actually if we do, wouldn’t that be just the ebbs and flows of a social framework? People come in, people leave. You make a connection here and a connection there and hope to linger in that ether of those network connections that’s always in a flux. Also isn’t blogging a sort of ’new media’ when compared to postcards or aerogram? When was the last time you sent or received one?ðŸ”—

item.title: Silo migration
item.description: I used WithKnown for about a minute several years ago. Loved the interface and software but it never really stood the test of time. Yesterday, while searching for older posts related to Uganda, I realized, I never quite moved those posts over. Spent about an hour yesterday and migrated those over to this portal. While at it, I also migrated my old twitter posts over. And with that I think all content is now present on this portal. Since the feed settings are limited to 10 most recent posts, I’m pretty sure this shouldn’t spam the RSS feeds. ðŸ”—
